src/framework/core/getAdapter.ts

adapter
Type : Adapter
Default value : { get nlp(): NlpAdapter { return new (getConfig().platform.nlp.constructor)(); }, get chat(): ChatAdapter { return new (getConfig().platform.chat.constructor)(); }, }

Convenience object to provide access to the NlpAdapter and ChatAdapter.

src/framework/core/utils/findBestNlpAnswerForTextRequest.ts

agents
Default value : getOrderedAgents()
doesResponsePassScoringThreshold
Default value : ( botResponse: NlpResponse, agentIndex: number, ): boolean => { const minimalAcceptableScore = agents[agentIndex].minScore; const textRequestResult = botResponse.textRequestResult; const score = textRequestResult.score; return score >= minimalAcceptableScore; }

Checks if the message passes the agent specific minimal threshold, i.e. the confidence of the NLP service exceeds some predefined and individually set threshold.
PRIMARY_AGENT_INDEX
Type : number
Default value : 0

src/framework/core/core.ts

chat
Type : ChatAdapter

Entry point into the framework, starts the server and the message handling. IMPORTANT: Make sure that you have already set the config (see ../main.ts) More information can be found at here.

src/framework/core/getInterceptors.ts

chatToCore
Type : Promise<Interceptor<ChatAdapterRequest, ChatAdapterRequest>>
Default value : getConfig().interceptors.chatToCore()

More information regarding the usage of the interceptors can be found at Interceptor
nlpToCore
Type : Promise<Interceptor<NlpResponse, NlpResponse>>
Default value : getConfig().interceptors.nlpToCore()
nlpToNlp
Type : Promise<Interceptor<NlpResponse, NlpResponse>>
Default value : getConfig().interceptors.nlpToNlp()

src/tools/cli.ts

colorizeSuccess
Default value : chalk.bold.green
logger
Type : Logger
stdin
Default value : process.stdin
stdout
Default value : console.log
url
Type : string

src/framework/configuration/configSlackDf2.ts

config
Type : Config<SlackAdapter, DialogflowV2Adapter>
Default value : { interceptors: interceptorConfig, platform: { chat: platformChatSlack, nlp: platformNlpDialogflowV2, }, server: serverConfig, }

An exemplar configuration using Slack and DialogflowV2. You can exchange elements (e.g. use Facebook instead of Slack) by using a different respective (messenger) configuration.

src/framework/configuration/configFacebookRasa.ts

config
Type : Config<FacebookAdapter, RasaAdapter>
Default value : { interceptors: interceptorConfig, platform: { chat: platformChatFacebook, nlp: platformNlpRasa, }, server: serverConfig, }

An exemplar configuration using Facebook and Rasa. You can exchange elements (e.g. use Slack instead of Facebook) by using a different respective (messenger) configuration.

src/framework/configuration/configFacebookDf2.ts

config
Type : Config<FacebookAdapter, DialogflowV2Adapter>
Default value : { interceptors: interceptorConfig, platform: { chat: platformChatFacebook, nlp: platformNlpDialogflowV2, }, server: serverConfig, }

An exemplar configuration using Facebook and DialogflowV2. You can exchange elements (e.g. use Slack instead of Facebook) by using a different respective (messenger) configuration.

config

test/chat_adapter/facebook/_mocks/_FacebookTestServer.ts

facebookMessageRoute
Type : string
Default value : '/me/messages'
SECRET

Default value : generateId()

src/framework/configuration/interceptorConfig.ts

interceptorConfig
Type : InterceptorConfig
Default value : { chatToCore: MirrorInterceptor.getInstance, nlpToCore: MirrorInterceptor.getInstance, nlpToNlp: MirrorInterceptor.getInstance, }

Simple interceptor configuration. Interceptors are interceptors across the framework to manipulate messages or perform further actions. These exemplar interceptors are only used to mirror an incoming message without further modifications. You can write arbitrarily complex interceptors, for more information see here.

src/framework/logger.ts

logger
Default value : winston.createLogger({ format: winston.format.json(), level: logLevel, transports: [ new winston.transports.File({ filename: 'error.log', level: 'error' }), new winston.transports.File({ filename: 'userDefinedLogging.log' }), ], })
logLevel
Default value : process.env.loggingLevel || 'verbose'

We initialize and export an instance of a winston logger, using the default npm logging levels (see https://www.npmjs.com/package/winston#logging-levels)

All logs with a severity equal or above error are stored in error.log

All logs with a severity equal or above the logLevel set by yourself (default: verbose) are stored in userDefinedLogging.log

test/_mocks/DummyNlpAdapter.ts

nlpMessageMap
Default value : new Map<string, string[]>()
platformDummyAdapter
Type : NlpConfig<DummyNlpAdapter>
Default value : { agents: { first: { executionIndex: 0, minScore: 0.8, token: '', url: '', languageCode: '', }, second: { executionIndex: 0, minScore: 0.8, token: '', url: '', languageCode: '', }, }, constructor: DummyNlpAdapter, name: 'dummyNlpAdapter', }

src/framework/configuration/platformChatCli.ts

platformChatCli
Type : ChatConfig<CliAdapter>
Default value : { appSecret: '', constructor: CliAdapter, name: 'cli', url: '', webhook_path: '/webhook', }

Exemplar configuration of the CLI adapter. If you are unsure which information is required and how to retrieve it, take a look at the CLI section of our documentation. This configuration is used in case no chat configuration was provided and can be used in order to test the framework via the CLI client.

src/framework/configuration/platformChatFacebook.ts

platformChatFacebook
Type : FacebookChatConfig
Default value : { appSecret: 'YOUR_APP_SECRET', constructor: FacebookAdapter, name: 'facebook', pageAccessToken: 'YOUR_PAGE_ACCESS_TOKEN', url: 'https://graph.facebook.com/', verifyToken: 'YOUR_VERIFY_TOKEN', version: 'v3.3', webhook_path: '/webhook', }

Exemplar configuration of the Facebook adapter. If you are unsure which information is required and how to retrieve it, take a look at the Facebook section of our documentation.

src/framework/configuration/platformChatSlack.ts

platformChatSlack
Type : SlackConfig
Default value : { appSecret: 'YOUR_SLACK_SECRET', token: 'YOUR_SLACK_OAUTH_TOKEN', constructor: SlackAdapter, name: 'slack', url: 'https://slack.com/api/', webhook_path: '/webhook', }

Exemplar configuration of the Slack adapter. If you are unsure which information is required and how to retrieve it, take a look at the Slack section of our documentation.

src/framework/configuration/platformNlpDialogflow.ts

platformNlpDialogflow
Type : DialogflowConfig
Default value : { agents: { first_agent: { defaultLifespan: 2, executionIndex: 0, project_id: '', //Not required for V1, can be left empty. languageCode: 'en', minScore: 0.75, token: 'YOUR_DIALOGFLOW_TOKEN_FROM_AGENT_1', url: 'https://api.dialogflow.com/v1/query?v=20150910', }, second_agent: { defaultLifespan: 2, executionIndex: 1, project_id: '', //Not required for V1, can be left empty. languageCode: 'en', minScore: 0.5, token: 'YOUR_DIALOGFLOW_TOKEN_FROM_AGENT_2', url: 'https://api.dialogflow.com/v1/query?v=20150910', }, }, constructor: DialogflowAdapter, name: 'dialogflow', }

Exemplar configuration of the Dialogflow adapter (using version 1 of the Dialogflow API). If you are unsure which information is required and how to retrieve it, take a look at the Dialogflow section of our documentation.

IMPORTANT: Version 1 is deprecated and the documentation might be incomplete. Please consider switching to version 2.

src/framework/configuration/platformNlpDialogflowV2.ts

platformNlpDialogflowV2
Type : DialogflowConfig
Default value : { agents: { my_first_agent: { defaultLifespan: 2, executionIndex: 0, languageCode: 'en-US', minScore: 0.8, project_id: 'GCP-ID-Project1', token: 'path/to/your/dialogflowApiToken1.json', url: '', // You do not need an endpoint url. This is provided by the Dialogflow dependency itself. }, my_second_agent: { defaultLifespan: 2, executionIndex: 1, languageCode: 'en-US', minScore: 0.75, project_id: 'GCP-ID-Project2', token: 'path/to/your/dialogflowApiToken2.json', url: '', // You do not need an endpoint url. This is provided by the Dialogflow dependency itself. }, }, constructor: DialogflowV2Adapter, name: 'dialogflowV2', }

Exemplar configuration of the Dialogflow adapter (using version 2 of the Dialogflow API). If you are unsure which information is required and how to retrieve it, take a look at the Dialogflow section of our documentation.

src/framework/configuration/platformNlpRasa.ts

platformNlpRasa
Type : NlpConfig<RasaAdapter>
Default value : { agents: { rasa_test: { executionIndex: 0, languageCode: 'en', minScore: 0.5, token: 'your_secret_token', url: 'http://localhost:5005', }, }, constructor: RasaAdapter, name: 'rasa', }

Exemplar configuration of the Rasa adapter. If you are unsure which information is required and how to retrieve it, take a look at the Rasa section of our documentation.

src/framework/configuration/platformNlpSnips.ts

platformNlpSnips
Type : NlpConfig<SnipsAdapter>
Default value : { agents: { snips_test: { executionIndex: 0, languageCode: 'en', minScore: 0.8, token: 'your_secret token', url: 'https://www.url-to-your-server.com', }, }, constructor: SnipsAdapter, name: 'snips', }

Exemplar configuration of the Snips adapter. If you are unsure which information is required and how to retrieve it, take a look at the Snips section of our documentation.

src/framework/configuration/serverConfig.ts

serverConfig
Type : ServerConfig
Default value : { // The port your application runs on. If your application runs inside of a proxy, // do not enter the port the messaging platform uses to communicate with, but the internally mapped port. port: 4000, }
